document.title: CTE Model Curriculum Standards: Energy, Environment, and Utilities

D9D1CC7AACF945519B2BD21A46DD646E.description: Demonstrate discretion in interacting with customers in field and retail environments.

CBD135EE95E74DEC9F7CE23D3D7675A1.description: Describe and demonstrate effective follow-up techniques.

06856618F03A490A8544094B59216D62.description: Apply techniques for keeping the customer informed.

68997DE79A484ACD9525F1F3B264272F.description: Apply techniques for instilling customer confidence and satisfaction.

E9D75FCDFB504E218ACE85C99FE1E838.description: Demonstrate appropriate personal hygiene and professional attire.

568A2715E08442EF95C51B6AAFD3E31C.description: Demonstrate the appropriate applications of network and user data mining and behavior profiling.

BA48DF708BE54120AF2D2BB39B1B2655.description: Explain the need and strategies for network security and integrity.

9BE094F611A04B189319A1B128036851.description: Understand switching, routing, and security systems and technologies for wireless and Internet networking

D603120886974F6D8B7DE146AA9F6587.description: Consider privacy and security issues of the telecommunications systems.

8C1F592A67FF48DA8688D67CA9D422A2.description: Understand the theory of twisted pair design and shielding.

D8DEE8ECBB2046E596E55E54B654ADFD.description: Prepare work site plans to demonstrate proficiency in site requirements and considerations.

FF199F925E9F4D6BAA728DC7743E0771.description: Install, repair, terminate, and test network cabling.

DF05D0FFB8A546A58BA716E91BF50881.description: Inspect and demonstrate proficiency in the use of tools, equipment, and test equipment used in the voice and data communications industry.

4CD05BEBAF334BF3BD89B831724D07B3.description: Demonstrate proficiency in basic AC and DC circuits.

0E6EF2D05D264D1B93FFC1A950C8F5C5.description: Practice troubleshooting and repairing telecommunication system wiring.

2C04FC85CBB04CF385706E234D45240E.description: Understand access technologies, including wireline and wireless end-to-end switching and signaling.

6AD637268C684E5D80A2C37C0FFA9C5F.description: Understand the differences between function and uses of wireless and cable networks.

8FB5FA185B0C4DEF8D45BBF5C742EE8A.description: Demonstrate proficiency in making electrical connections, splices, and basic field repair.

6443F0740AC84A9F8CE1D27F9EA5E414.description: Demonstrate and apply safety procedures and practices for traffic control, pole climbing, roadside safety, electrical hazards, and data line safety checks.

C1402407D410415C97A25DBA2C8473B0.description: Research the components, interaction, and operations of fixed-wire telecommunications systems.

9E6C69C21CE44DB8A9B0D4462849023F.description: Understand the function and basic operations of communications satellites.

7084016B8BCC462C8474E0ED1DD354CA.description: Describe mobile network components and basic operation, including cellular principles and AMPS (1G), 2G; digital radio voice communications and digital cellular; data communications and spectrum-sharing technologies; frequency division multiple access (FDMA), time division multiple access (TDMA), CDMA, orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM) and 3G cellular; CDMA and 4G mobile cellular; LTE, wireless local area networks (LANs) and WiFi.

434B591AF09440FA88CE9C835AFC4E45.description: Research the different functions and uses of wireless and cable networks.

6EDEE9BEC0FD42BEAAF6A202875196BC.description: Explain code division multiple access (CDMA), wireless technologies, services, and applications.

3FAFAAF4EDE3452EAD20B26722C5D7A9.description: Understand radio frequency (RF), air interface, and radio access network (RAN).

91447B746C06489EA91748ABE2071E96.description: Identify switching, routing, and security systems and technologies for wireless and Internet networking.

F64B6BB0A787414B811EF7FDEB6B1185.description: Describe access technologies, including wireline and wireless end-to-end switching and signaling.

BD8E43FA6F804AE8B6DC548F1BD2BC0F.description: Understand mobile wireless services and applications.

14FB357C012E40579EE1695E54D3C978.description: Research the components, interaction, and operations of wireless telecommunications systems.

B14362112CCB4743A5B97B7C414906BF.description: Research applications and trends in satellite communications, including personal, commercial, military and government, and global applications.

96B90A9242E64D87B316D633492DC8CE.description: Explain propagation and interference, including radio noise, ionosphere effects, troposphere effects, interference between satellite networks, and interference with terrestrial networks.

1473840CE641422B95F70BBA29B1676B.description: Understand the importance of modulation, multiplexing, and multiple access.

E27FC6F7DA6A46EAB0850CD102A757DB.description: Understand frequency bands and those used in satellite communications.

F6BC0E8CA8C94F89A83913F47F582015.description: Analyze satellite system architecture, including the network configuration, remotes, satellite subsystems, ground stations, and network management.

A580DFFD887444B98E0CD6CCFB613D51.description: Understand satellite systems, including geo-synchronous earth orbiting (GEO), low-earth orbiting (LEO), medium-earth orbiting (MEO), high-earth orbiting (HEO), and mobile satellite systems.

9C2C488C44354A578DBF418B367C03CA.description: Understand satellite orbits, including launch vehicles and the launching of satellites.

F93DDA05A6584BB988EC6E076C6FAD1C.description: Learn the vocabulary and acronyms associated with satellite communications.

43B2041058104B258DC15060FDD97A86.description: Describe common types of satellites and their respective functions.

102020A6B1404E4394A9BB052D0194D8.description: Illustrate and describe the basic elements of satellite communications.

AD6DAC20622F49889D88662D789CE146.description: Analyze the limitations of terrestrial communications and the advantages and disadvantages of satellites.

5D7BE37E1F1F4AFB9A00811365A61D88.description: Understand the evolution of satellite communications.

CB8F0A3AE7A04369BC7D19DB09D834D3.description: Examine the role and functions of satellites in telecommunications.

C13C3B86DEB045B09BA2687B40A0D58B.description: Understand the uses and effects of new technologies, such as social networking and cloud computing, on the network.

F9D0C069875946B68C09DA033DB2342D.description: Obtain a working knowledge of communications protocols and standards with an emphasis on their importance in network engineering and network operation.

C657286D21F645DF8E07DAFFB8038B0C.description: Compare the benefits, drawbacks, and technology behind voice over IP (VoIP) using IP PBXs, IP phones and Internet telephony service providers (ITSP), and IPTV.

14A7C8230FF94AF68E814880A801803E.description: Recognize technologies such as frame relay, ATM, MLPS, Ethernet, and TCP/IP and determine each technology's impact on network design, communication capabilities, and quality of service (QOS).

6D65697238364527B760D2DFA736A4EF.description: Understand the basics of local, metropolitan, and wide area networks (LANs, MANs, and WANs), including the differences between network bridging/switching and routing.

F1139D2EDC374231B7DC0B1F1636CA8C.description: Compare private voice network design alternatives using tie-lines, Centrex, virtual private networks (VPN), and hosted services.

097D7377D1194646B393052027C107AC.description: Evaluate the differences between the various access methods, including DSL, cable modems, wireless (cellular, WiMax, Wi-Fi), T1, and carrier Ethernet.

8D3DD34D62D14F5ABE23FA5DF7267AFE.description: Define the components of data networks, such as modems, virtual circuits, hubs, switches, and routers.

EE6E464223CC4D079F938C76BCDE8EF0.description: Compare and contrast the components of voice networks, such as carrier switches, routing, PBXs, T1 trunks, switched versus dedicated circuits, and packet and wireless networks.

0E63DA7564824B2EB740A202D0253098.description: Describe the differences between analog and digital transmission and the migration to a converged digital/optical network for voice, data, and video.

9AD44A68375941C495C88C4CB988562D.description: Demonstrate understanding and use of the basic and emerging technologies that impact the telecommunications industry.

C7F89EC7F26A4FCCA3502094C3EDB307.description: Understand signaling: pulse dialing and dual tone multiple frequency (DTMF).

BD98A70F694443A18451DC6A71CE4F5D.description: Describe public switched telephone network (PSTN) and signaling system 7 (SS7).

294DE10FC6E743F48497BB64D31A0D3C.description: Understand digital transmission concepts (capacity, bits-per-second), converting sound to digital signals (PCM, CODECS), and compensating for transmission impairments (attenuation, noise, delay, jitter).

81D43ABF24314233AFF134C8903DA705.description: Compare analog transmission concepts (bandwidth, voiceband, modulation), analog circuits and sounds, and plain ordinary telephone service (POTS).

B3AB353DDDFE4C5397540BC0B8096FAB.description: Understand the fundamentals of voice telephony and voice characteristics.

ED103B937D934B1895DED8A864D1499D.description: Evaluate the effects of telecommunications media and networks (telephone, television, cellular, social networking, etc.).

B44E1F0977934AF4ACDE6E4D12745B62.description: Understand the relationship between telecommunications and society.

85423CD62F7F4FD39EA7BE776B4A1074.description: Understand the basic principles and concepts that impact the telecommunications industry, including systems, concepts, and regulations.

comments: The Telecommunications pathway prepares students for employment and postsecondary education and training in the wireless and fixed-line communications industries. The sharing of information is essential for personal, commercial, educational, government, and military functions. Information is stored, sent, and accessed primarily via the telecommunications industries.

B628113874044A9AA650C8E7C66BABDC.description: Design and construct an electrical circuit with a power generation source.

8E09BDFFCFF744E191A97EA10D80D2A2.description: Measure voltage, amperage, and resistance using a volt-ohm meter (VOM) and a digital volt-ohm meter (DVM).

68DE5BEC88964AEE82D8A549A86E8C97.description: Define and explain voltage, current, resistance, power, and energy.

7A2E8CED33DC4B1A81B3C6D1D8AA369C.description: Understand the components and workings of the gas transmission and distribution network.

F1CF44F7EAB84BA68D9BBD88FBA09BD3.description: Understand the components and workings of the electric transmission and distribution network.

F03EABC7DCB746218F5D0082DD5B80B8.description: Understand the interrelationships among components of systems.

CE11327F7F4C4E928B410873F7575388.description: Identify electric power transmission equipment and systems.

C56071288C114DBA9E47D2005660F15B.description: Understand the emerging technologies in electric power transmission.

5DECBCF3FB604898821574E55B2B80AC.description: Explain the need for electric distribution systems and how they are designed to operate.

141F73D9F71F4CB2A09917398F4A2ADD.description: Describe the electric power transmission principles and processes.

14967A2AF68543C0B4D6E7ADCEE8C558.description: Research methods of energy procurement, transmission, distribution, and storage.

01B116A365624B6098E0D7543C39C000.description: Conduct tests and inspections of products, services, or processes to evaluate quality or performance.

23B50F31E17A45E0868D231B66B117DA.description: Operate, repair, and test machines, devices, and equipment based on electrical or mechanical principles in order to diagnose machine malfunctions, using basic hand and small electric tools and equipment.

449E5861290F42B09A934684C34C9A61.description: Explain the fission process, including the construction of fission product barriers.

4043774ED4D24D39B2B3F24A9782A6E8.description: Demonstrate understanding of reactor startup and shutdown procedures.

EF5DE83AEA074CFA9B99DC9C6513B9CC.description: Explain the general design overview of the basic reactor types.

A26BF14CF44C46D2BDEF6EAB2E8B4442.description: Explain the basic atomic and nuclear physics terms, unit, definitions, and basic concepts, including atomic structure, nuclear interactions and reactions, sources of residual heat/decay heat, and reactor operation.

0EB35BC961964377A33A2306355E225F.description: Understand the components of electrical systems, including switchyard construction, transformers, relays, circuit breakers, and motors.

FCF5B43D8FAB49AB98C39D25EDEAA1CF.description: Use the fundamental concepts associated with electricity (e.g., electric charge, electric current).

9A230426803E4F21840FE7E0357029B1.description: Understand and apply basic knowledge and skills necessary for nuclear power generation and nuclear power plant personnel.

20781EA971154337ACF04BE04BC4EE65.description: Describe the theory, construction, and application of the mechanical components of various types of power generation systems.

323FE78127B1456FB955A97F3272435E.description: Describe the location of equipment in the plant, how the equipment operates, and normal operating parameters.

A991CB87AEBB45A7BCD57DC749B32104.description: Summarize the basic operating principles of fossil, hydroelectric, and internal combustion systems.

E407DF85440E42978339EB1C87BEEBD2.description: Discriminate the differences and similarities of power generation, including use of different fuel types and different power plant uses.

CE52382474834E298D98D21280E58615.description: Classify the components of electrical generating systems, including boilers, generators, alternators, turbines, motors, engines, pumps, and switchgear.

18C7950C7F0E45AC868928300F9CD012.description: Explain and use the fundamental laws and principles of electricity and magnetism.

5F444CBB944E4901BE23FA8E98C669BF.description: Understand nonnuclear power generation plant operations (coal, oil, natural gas, solar, wind, geothermal power, hydroelectric, or biofuel).

6B5BBB4239034BCD9A440D0643D0AF20.description: Compare and contrast the advantages and disadvantages of using ocean wave energy technologies for energy.

82389391BF954C75B403B004DEC5D365.description: Explain wave energy technologies (terminator devices, oscillating water column, point absorbers, attenuators, and overtopping devices).

923C8701B9714BFAA27E672F9F5303CC.description: Describe how wave power is harnessed in near shore, offshore, and far shore locations.

B58A553908C848CB9F6B3C6F1735C782.description: Explain how ocean wave energy is used to produce electric energy.

DD1B01411DAA45759D389B7C14308A22.description: Explain the process of nuclear fission.

A849DD0945AA42B5BAEFB79067243A2E.description: Explain how nuclear power is used to produce electric energy.

08A32B29B97A48CEABA9324016CF634E.description: Describe the major sources, scale, and impacts of biomass energy.

24048C5DFD534E8E86BD218FF2E0C074.description: Explain biomass conversion, including thermal and chemical processes used to produce electric energy.

F92FF20EBA0C435E8FE8719677188100.description: Investigate emerging and alternative electric power generation technologies and fuel sources.

BDF8E9DAC9AB4BC8BF0802E7DD614D08.description: Describe how cost and efficiency rates are determined for each source.

CBDFE12480194E2B9F3CAD6583B358AF.description: Evaluate and list the advantages and disadvantages for each energy source.

1CF7AC7000AA4EA8915F0226A02BDAFA.description: Explain how each source was created and is used to produce electricity.

1D64FA8B8C7B42D69221E3036F8070C3.description: Explain the conventional electric power generation system and process (coal, oil, natural gas, solar, wind, geothermal, and hydroelectric).

276681CF22BF4787B4D3AF6E194F584E.description: Identify various conventional electric power generation fuel sources and the cost and efficiency issues associated with each.

CB557D7DE4D4413A9B11AF2F204F82D1.description: Describe the process of electric metering and billing for energy consumption.

F804013DDA3B408DACE285DDD2EF6A2D.description: Explain the role of regulatory bodies in the energy industry (Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, Public Utilities Commission [PUC]).

0E413C73EB45462A94CECE29126ADCFB.description: Explain the different structures of energy companies, including investor-owned utilities, municipalities (and associated utility practices, such as water/wastewater), electric cooperatives, and independent power producers and the different lines of energy business, including electric and gas.

C9E9522499C04749B703A16E82200C91.description: Identify the role and function of generation, transmission, and distribution organizations.

3BDF5EEF6B924B8EB3640553B692F910.description: Demonstrate an understanding of basic direct current (DC) electrical-circuit skills.

1F2A089890D94C16B1833E16E6E7FEC1.description: Explain the flow of energy from generation through distribution to the customer.

43314AA1A91748EBAE77522BCD73E342.description: Identify the differences and challenges in energy needs, sources, and uses in developing regions.

F445665E399D4B0D87F9EA0AB9150736.description: Describe the past, present, and anticipated demand for, and use of, energy.

5219CB478A994A58BCA11C12175B770E.description: Explore the basic conventional and emerging principles and concepts of the energy industry, including energy production, energy transmission, and alternative energy technologies

comments: The Energy and Power Technology pathway provides learning opportunities for students interested in preparing for careers in the energy and power industries.

D473E38BF10C41E0A1887001479EF761.description: Create an environmental law or regulation and explain how it will impact the environment.

BECBC7FCA10A436F92E33D1881DA9E87.description: Compare and contrast environmental laws and regulations that may have a positive or negative impact on the environment and the economy.

7969D8B4E9A24866943C4175358D1E54.description: Understand current regulations concerning recycling, solid waste, land use management, water quality, and renewable and nonrenewable energy.

3475A36E58B5483EBAC0D567F17969C2.description: Identify and discuss major environmental laws and policies, including the regulatory and legislative processes used to create such laws.

315D257F7BA147B693E64E04C5297A74.description: Identify and analyze issues, legislation, and regulations related to energy and the environment.

F23FDE825D6B431EB51DA453BF330CF2.description: Analyze efficient solar water heating systems.

3101DDB30D3848A69394EAB1821F5AF2.description: Describe solar hot water financial support programs and regulations.

23CFC86BFBCE41E1853B4F14B84247A9.description: Describe the requirements of solar water heaters that meet regulations.

62EEA7CDE84F4C2EB4CF4E5C6F06E047.description: Identify the characteristics of solar heated water design and installation.

C1850AF0E6104BEB9309B3C7B803E925.description: Prepare an efficient solar heated water design and installation plan.

AC86950782554D7E9D9E9380103D6142.description: Describe the concerns and strategies for catastrophic storm water events and management.

AA76E2AD156F4EA1A61DB7EB15FE1B4F.description: Analyze and interpret contaminated harbor and river sediment.

6D54F4A8D79D4C009846513985A04634.description: Use the Hydrologic Engineering Centers River Analysis System (HEC-RAS).

B87862B4C0874B80A1E0401655067FF0.description: Understand the principles and applications of drainage engineering.

95E91840CEB74781895813E4A4114730.description: Understand the designs and tools used in water flow management.

EAEA9A8B5F4F4C3F977D2658FAB60BD5.description: Evaluate the impact and flow management of storm water, rivers, and groundwater.

D6FC16877BB4499B82C5A441B8D2A3B2.description: Understand the functions and operations of water storage, reservoirs, aqueducts, and dams.

53D6612A413D4595BAC93D8A47B8954C.description: Describe the role of environmental engineering and green energy in water systems.

DE6A9D3CDFE34950AB518EFD7D77E3A3.description: Analyze strategies for improving energy efficiencies in water collection and distribution.

DBF8ED1236D9427B89D7690FD6876B30.description: Understand water reuse: issues, strategies, technologies, and applications.

F103E6DF27D8425FBFA05570DC892AF1.description: Research drinking-water sources, systems, treatment, and conservation.

4437210EB6CB4D0EA3BC57E3E2CBDD23.description: Compare costs of alternate/renewable energy sources, systems, and appliances and traditional energy sources, systems, and appliances.

8782A72E17F7457F859D6673F4C546CA.description: Outline how domestic and industrial appliances and systems affect the environment, such as water units and heating and cooling systems.

BECA08308EB94749827034769B39B8EC.description: Understand the relationship between power and energy efficiency.

C8C9CFE785E345F4AA65EF3039405979.description: Implement processes to support energy efficiency.

C959EE25937F4A22A964FE09DF17D0ED.description: Describe the basic U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and California Air Resources Board (ARB) roles and regulations.

595D6985EECA4BCBA9AD508A5BCD6E17.description: Understand U.S. and California laws and regulations related to air pollution control programs and health effects of air pollution.

6A5715430D6640BC933651BCFA045ED8.description: Research air pollutants and their threat to human health.

14E8DF4945C94D088E90632BBB7C94EC.description: Summarize the causes of air pollutants and their chemical composition.

89FAB35070F04555A4ED108B6F9ACBA4.description: Understand the elements that create outdoor air quality.

439F2D0B85FB41C38132A8C105779085.description: Research the role of air quality management and systems, their operations, and their impact on the environment.

8B914593FB194FB0A7DAB52B141D7DE9.description: Develop strategies to maximize the effectiveness of land use planning.

8CAF5F7EC83945AD844CE7BA9FBFA56A.description: Explain the laws and regulations pertaining to land use planning.

5B0F7CB895DB4DE4BE769AE2A2ED78B7.description: Summarize the relationship between land use planning and energy use and distribution.

DFE1797EC0FA4814AF569BA16A6EB774.description: Identify the aspects of land use planning and describe current trends.

53085D19F60E4B558DF283852E807152.description: Demonstrate the need for, and methods of, land use planning.

20A1C4DD16D946CA8621A6C915962D75.description: Describe the composition, role, and function of ecosystems, including trends affecting viability.

9DE39955E1DF44FF8997F41B4F52DB41.description: Describe the need for, and role of, habitat preservation.

CB58AD01F72D425495BA5F049110FDA6.description: Understand the field of land use management and its potential for environmental impact.

BFC6C990334E4FC983C12ADB01DADE9C.description: Design solid waste disposal processes that lessen environmental impacts and improve recycling.

74DC663447B84960926327ADBF1BC9B6.description: Explain the types and sources of hazardous waste and associated safety practices and legal requirements for handling and disposing of such waste.

EC93FA1C4C4A40C7B666F3D946637018.description: Identify wastewater treatment processes that lessen environmental impacts and improve water reuse.

90ADABD7C8E94160A4DD3816EBD9EBA6.description: Explore the causes and effects of pollution linked to wastewater treatment facilities.

8A7BD923FD594BEC954D642F589FE8AC.description: Understand the role of waste and storm water management systems, their operation, and their impact on the environment.

348A9D3D68564D67ADBA62D9FDEBCEB8.description: Identify the role and impact of waste management systems and their operations on the environment.

4C1A9357903244788096BD58CC664200.description: Analyze the impacts of energy conversion processes as they relate to activities across the environment.

13DB4E13737E49A88C125D00F9CD83E2.description: Identify the basic principles of energy systems, including chemical, hydraulic, pneumatic, electrical, nuclear, solar, wind, and geothermal.

3676CCF0A79D41BFB9DFDF2948D6525C.description: Define the basic terms, characteristics, and concepts of physical and chemical processes related to energy conversion.

697348208FA74D5180356B1015CE85CF.description: Research the environmental implications of energy conversion processes and energy transmission systems.

CC3FB675F7B74D6B900DF0737D42773D.description: Identify the sources of, and impacts attributable to, habitat alteration.

4F08EC7C1839410E982EB5BCF8742850.description: Describe the attributes and proliferation of hardscape.

597F7EA4EEC44525A044741A093F8AA3.description: Define the causes of erosion and soil depletion.

85BEDDA246F344549A75427C6D1DB2ED.description: Recognize the actions that cause resource depletion.

8B2DF8A06B1B45748C15F4008897D5D9.description: Describe the sources of, and impacts attributable to, pollution and contamination.

33512D03DE2B4CAA981296888160921A.description: Evaluate regional interactive systems and elements that create harmful environmental effects.

09B7305B1DC143F6B552E3982CE4D3D5.description: Assess impacts of greenhouse gases on the environment.

C3BCA622A347465CB09C1F808892AD28.description: Explain how greenhouse gases are generated.

3FA50BEAD4FB475BA67351C83DD95129.description: Identify the greenhouse effect and climate change.

5C9DAF494BF245839CF37B13B18B1007.description: Analyze the impact of climate upon human activities and needs.

12216808C5C44BC298C4FDF3D5074CBD.description: Identify world climate patterns and summarize factors that affect climate.

8F5422BE790F4F6B80FD96393AB12D38.description: Describe the natural elements that interact to create climate.

EB24CEF4A9C2419282F2B47DEFAA4057.description: Identify and describe the global interactive systems and elements that create and sustain climate.

393CF5A8868B483E9743C6EC53A89DAF.description: List jobs in the community that result from, or are influenced by, processing and using energy resources.

BD51304EB55F4ABDB84F132C675BCD3B.description: Compare the advantages and disadvantages of energy resources in terms of the effects on the environment.

1B9BDE9031DD4C159F8C460CC8BEFE60.description: Discover new and emerging energy resources.

8CAB68994F1240B19AD68968150490AF.description: Classify energy resources by type: depletable, nondepletable, renewable, and nonrenewable.

D9331F4114274B4DBF1F10606A0E1226.description: Identify energy resources and the effects of these resources on the environment.

comments: The Environmental Resources pathway prepares students for employment, postsecondary education, and/or training in a variety of environmental industries.

EC496417B8C642C5BC45EE5F40423F85.description: Create a portfolio, or similar collection of work, that offers evidence through assessment and evaluation of skills and knowledge competency as contained in the anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators.

CE07EB0FCD154D33AE3B5445FE256BE4.description: Employ entrepreneurial practices and behaviors appropriate to Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector opportunities.

766A70D194BA44F5BB122FB7AE40E71D.description: Demonstrate entrepreneurship skills and knowledge of self-employment options and innovative ventures.

E8110E1DA89A40D785EBAA99F940DEAA.description: Demonstrate proficiency in a career technical pathway that leads to certification, licensure, and/or continued learning at the postsecondary level.

FD8CD030B3144BD5B78A270D340FD7D2.description: Utilize work-based/workplace learning experiences to demonstrate and expand upon knowledge and skills gained during classroom instruction and laboratory practices specific to the Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector program of study.

comments: Demonstrate and apply the knowledge and skills contained in the Energy, Environment, and Utilities anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators in classroom, laboratory, and workplace settings, and through the SkillsUSA career technical student organization.

7001535799764D519827B616C794CEF1.description: Identify and evaluate questions that require skilled investigation to solve current problems cited in literature or media, or observed through personal observations.

29200B6B25954441A75029BFDEAD366C.description: Maintain and troubleshoot equipment used in the energy, environment, and utilities industry.

3EFF62750FA74286B8A2352E424111F2.description: Coordinate with industry experts for specific technical knowledge and skills.

1177E173E8344852940E49B5B57EE603.description: Construct projects and products specific to the Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector requirements and expectations.

D2AC47F7B702431183BDCBFAB33F5939.description: Comply with the rules, regulations, and expectations of all aspects of the Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector.

16043C9F56F9472C805F087A508B4F20.description: Interpret and explain terminology and practices specific to the Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector.

comments: Apply essential technical knowledge and skills common to all pathways in the Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector.

D6DA2D57A99C43DC8BD4C719978DFFD6.description: Participate in interactive teamwork to solve real Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector issues and problems.

29A609C2F38242358BEB54E2546DEF6A.description: Respect individual and cultural differences and recognize the importance of diversity in the workplace.

772DF5C2FA2540C9ADA1A06F1CF0082B.description: Understand that the modern world is an international community and requires an expanded global view.

FA834D5176BA4D5E85E9716852895DA2.description: Explain how professional associations and organizations and associated leadership development and competitive career development activities enhance academic preparation, promote career choices, and contribute to employment opportunities.

AACD8AAD5B12475B9CB34BE295C239E0.description: Understand the characteristics and benefits of teamwork, leadership, and citizenship in the school, community, and workplace setting.

E0C24F5BF06D43028B5C1365513894C3.description: Identify the characteristics of successful teams, including leadership, cooperation, collaboration, and effective decision-making skills as applied in groups, teams, and career technical student organization activities.

5658E53FA0C443A78771294AE077FB4E.description: Define leadership and identify the responsibilities, competencies, and behaviors of successful leaders.

comments: Work with peers to promote divergent and creative perspectives, effective leadership, group dynamics, team and individual decision making, benefits of workforce diversity, and conflict resolution as practiced in the SkillsUSA career technical student organization.

AEB0548645534514A8D56ADD9BC0E244.description: Conform to rules and regulations regarding sharing of confidential information, as determined by Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector laws and practices.

2D9F3BC321F146529CE85D6DD3375DA1.description: Adhere to copyright and intellectual property laws and regulations, and use and appropriately cite proprietary information.

FDF4E4C790444B2887B9B5DCDB34D795.description: Analyze organizational culture and practices within the workplace environment.

969656869E77430D878439408DE85C7D.description: Explain the importance of personal integrity, confidentiality, and ethical behavior in the workplace.

9E66C42BF3F84C0096A3480C94D1B294.description: Demonstrate ethical and legal practices consistent with Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector workplace standards.

91BA472B6C9640BD91BCEC8586899A4B.description: Identify local, district, state, and federal regulatory agencies, entities, laws, and regulations related to the Energy, Environment, and Utilities industry sector.

69E54D84D46546BBA7DF7F7F87597894.description: Access, analyze, and implement quality assurance standards of practice.

comments: Practice professional, ethical, and legal behavior, responding thoughtfully to diverse perspectives and resolving contradictions when possible, consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and organizational norms.

D1060624A422460A9DFB49F76B49EACC.description: Explore issues of global significance and document the impact on the Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector.

F53F6D288EE04F6894E8F1C7F806AD04.description: Demonstrate the qualities and behaviors that constitute a positive and professional work demeanor, including appropriate attire for the profession.

56EB546D340E48E0899453E8FE966665.description: Demonstrate knowledge and practice of responsible financial management.

2BF524E2FFB8438C9697AD2CCF3A3E33.description: Apply high-quality techniques to product or presentation design and development.

A22C29978AA64D539B8B90EA3791E12D.description: Practice time management and efficiency to fulfill responsibilities.

D4B291D4A145409BAC0B285B7464303E.description: Understand the need to adapt to changing and varied roles and responsibilities.

EA12C3A50D894E1592848BEADC540145.description: Explain the importance of accountability and responsibility in fulfilling personal, community, and workplace roles.

0F5A1AA38CA44E48887D72C3435A0610.description: Recognize how financial management impacts the economy, workforce, and community.

comments: Initiate, and participate in, a range of collaborations demonstrating behaviors that reflect personal and professional responsibility, flexibility, and respect in the Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector workplace environment and community settings.

4D55C93B1DC44076BB29327AD95017CD.description: Recognize potential and actual hazardous conditions as they arise.

27BB73CFFA2D441BB7EDD2493BB815CD.description: Use tools and equipment in compliance with user manuals and training.

BF6E54AE4E754F10AB2ADAA5E6845600.description: Keep personal safety equipment in good working order.

730685575A6C4080AE64CA4F9A02F9D4.description: Use personal protective equipment (PPE), including safety glasses, hearing protection, gloves, work boots, and hard hats.

6714BC82507C4F2A8F61CF98F0F27FF3.description: Use safety equipment as specified by user manuals and safety training.

A75978F6455143F99366D6618FA6B871.description: Comply with energy industry safety procedures and proper ways to perform work.

FA628D72C2A54C1E83D03D36E977404F.description: Evaluate changes in the environment with respect to their impact on safety of self and others.

D967E98354834DD7BCCFE02DFFD481E2.description: Follow established safety procedures (OSHA regulations and utility company procedures).

69ED2A95F97249F59C5EBA4093EACF44.description: Identify both potential hazards and accident scenarios in the work environment.

68F5A00DB4F94221B97115D6BA892F18.description: Review the responsibility of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) to ensure workplace safety.

9FA6549ECF1341DE8C904057FDDF60A8.description: Maintain a safe and healthful working environment.

F4E5AA4E0CD14C68AFAA79049B9E9506.description: Demonstrate how to prevent and respond to work-related accidents or injuries; this includes demonstrating an understanding of ergonomics.

4C009C53CA784E65AA0C81EE8BBD7E5E.description: Practice personal safety when lifting, bending, or moving equipment and supplies.

26558EC4734D417B9FD99DE4744CC120.description: Use health and safety practices for storing, cleaning, and maintaining tools, equipment, and supplies.

8190C4D9030F4960814BF46E703CED0D.description: Interpret policies, procedures, and regulations for the workplace environment, including employer and employee responsibilities.

6B6532809A5040C3A5B1724750BEC635.description: Locate, and adhere to, Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) instructions.

comments: Demonstrate health and safety procedures, regulations, and personal health practices and determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and domain-specific words and phrases as related to the Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector workplace environment.

288EA2CE0E534674ADEC8896D7CCC5A4.description: Interpret information and draw conclusions, based on the best analysis, to make informed decisions.

AE1D7AD5F48F482DA8EA6CDC11553BF9.description: Use systems thinking to analyze how various components interact with each other to produce outcomes in a complex work environment.

315E81FF66D94703B5B7AB65E800A804.description: Solve predictable and unpredictable work-related problems using various types of reasoning (inductive, deductive) as appropriate.

4E551D95EFA64DE387AA63090E37DE3D.description: Identify and ask significant questions that clarify various points of view to solve problems.

comments: Conduct short, as well as more sustained, research to create alternative solutions to answer a question or solve a problem unique to the Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector using critical and creative thinking; logical reasoning, analysis, inquiry, and problem-solving techniques.

9CDD0866D8CC46E4B6FF03169465103A.description: Assess the value of various information and communication technologies to interact with constituent populations as part of a search of the current literature or in relation to the information task.

2907633E8AEB48C18446F2C469DC9332.description: Research past, present, and projected technological advances as they impact a particular pathway.

BC7432881F6644A3A02A169774F78AAA.description: Discern the quality and value of information collected using digital technologies, and recognize bias and intent of the associated sources.

EA6BBBEF77FE498B9F8B43B0FE01A90F.description: Use information and communication technologies to synthesize, summarize, compare, and contrast information from multiple sources.

E2EA80716F3349409E74370304BF7A66.description: Employ Web-based communications responsibly and effectively to explore complex systems and issues.

A24203C1D5DB4F66B347337715630B88.description: Use electronic reference materials to gather information and produce products and services.

comments: Use existing and emerging technology to investigate, research, and produce products and services, including new information, as required in the Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector workplace environment.

0E33AD3906E947B2990C7B958F0C05F6.description: Develop a career plan that reflects career interests, pathways, and postsecondary options.

4D04202FA28D426E8F3FC2BCE009010A.description: Understand how digital media are used by potential employers and postsecondary agencies to evaluate candidates.

EEEE9ECF2FFB411EBAA057ED0CF8C78D.description: Recognize the importance of small business in the California and global economies.

FF62C810918749BB96951B0A8B1AA12C.description: Recognize the role and function of professional organizations, industry associations, and organized labor in a productive society.

3255C8A250C6480FB66B40BA88107526.description: Integrate changing employment trends, societal needs, and economic conditions into career planning.

85AFAB828687467D914AC87A4BF3498C.description: Research the scope of career opportunities available and the requirements for education, training, certification, and licensure.

8F87D11F6E6B43998946B05A516E81CB.description: Explore how information and communication technologies are used in career planning and decision making.

C0D86351F403413DB470B4F11176D8FD.description: Evaluate personal character traits such as trust, respect, and responsibility and understand the impact they can have on career success.

02CA1DF62E3049C6B43A3D0BADD69653.description: Identify personal interests, aptitudes, information, and skills necessary for informed career decision making.

comments: Integrate multiple sources of career information from diverse formats to make informed career decisions, solve problems, and manage personal career plans.

827AD0F4A748439E913A965BF0CBB65A.description: Advocate and practice safe, legal, and responsible use of digital media information and communications technologies.

00C631039BDB430FA9AA730409810525.description: Communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences using a variety of media and formats.

B4C56C2C012349408347A0D708E30221.description: Demonstrate elements of written and electronic communication such as accurate spelling, grammar, and format.

6E720671B89140558177D5F3B758575B.description: Interpret verbal and nonverbal communications and respond appropriately.

42D87020A87B4ED69E492870D31FB8D2.description: Identify barriers to accurate and appropriate communication.

CA7FE8C2300E43EB8838EAF6FBAD941D.description: Recognize the elements of communication using a sender–receiver model.

comments: Acquire, and accurately use Energy, Environment, and Utilities sector terminology and protocols at the career and college readiness level for communicating effectively in oral, written, and multimedia formats.

Analyze and apply appropriate academic standards required for successful industry sector pathway completion leading to postsecondary education and employment. Refer to the Energy, Environment, and Utilities academic alignment matrix for identification of standards.
